Professional Training  Credits Instructor(s): Todd Potter This course is designed to give the student further instruction in Drafting and Model making. In the Fall Semester the course focuses on the fundamentals of hand drafting--Line weights, Layout, and Lettering. The Student will also learn basic principles of using Photoshop in making Paint Elevations to support the Design and Drafting process. The student will draft a representative design package for their portfolio. This will include a Plan, Section, Elevations and Details, plus a Paint Elevation/or Painted Model. The drafting package will be done in the style that meets current Broadway Standards. The Spring Semester course focuses on small in class projects which will develop their thought process, model making skills, rendering techniques, and CAD knowledge while drafting Set Props. They will explore the Design Process from a very non-traditional approach. The focus of the course is drawing humans and animals from live subjects, thereby learning to translate the three-dimensional world into two-dimensional terms. Drafting skills are important to all animators, regardless of their chosen media or focus. In particular, strong drafting skills are essential for character animators.    (Can be taken during same semester as Life Drawing: Anatomy H56.1312 -- emphasis is on drawing in Life Drawing: The Figure, whereas emphasis is on anatomy in Life Drawing: Anatomy)           Undergraduate Admissions Graduate Admissions Academic Services Student Life Financial Aid and Scholarships Career Development Counseling Services International Students Incoming Students Graduation Forms What is Special Programs? Drafting: Tisch School of the Arts at NYU                           Skip to content        Drama Drama News & Events Box Office About The Program How To Apply Faculty Administration Student Center Production Resource Office Production Archive High School Programs Summer in Drama Alumni FAQ  home > Drama        Drafting  First Year Course. Professional Training  Credits Instructor(s): Chris Jaehnig Introduction to Drafting is one of the first year graphics courses in Tech Track. The fall semester begins with fundamental mechanical drawing techniques and builds to drafting floor plans and sectional views of architecture. The spring semester develops specific theatre related drawings including a typical Broadway stage in plan and section, a dance dressed stage and a detailed elevation and plan of a building facade. The final weeks of the year are spent designing and drafting a simple set along with an introduction to computer aided drafting. Throughout the year, emphasis is placed upon clarity of information, aesthetically pleasing layout and a solid understanding the language of graphics.
